title: Lawyers slam CFTC's "mindboggling" probe of EFS market it helped set up
description: The US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) tried to regulate exchange of futures for swaps (EFS) transactions in 2004 and again in 2008. Then it tried to ban contingent EFS in 2010. All these attempts failed. Now the CFTC is investigating EFS trades for illegal off-exchange trading activity. Lawyers see a pattern emerging. Peter Madigan reports
